link_counts.title: Coming soon | Yet Another Software Suite

posts.name: Brian Wagg
posts.cooked:
Trying to give the limelight team a run for their money for the most over-the-top FRC trailer I see…

Excited to see what you folks have cooked up!

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: Yass queen! (I’m so sorry)
Don’t be! I fully expect and endorse this behavior!
I expect it to be pretty game changing. I made it super-simple for all kids and mentors to program with seamless sim integration.

posts.name: Tauseef Afraz
posts.cooked: Hey, don’t give any hints

Nothing that wasn’t already dropped!

Get the latest information on robotics competitions, team grants, and software updates. Learn how to register for robotics competitions and explore new opportunities for teams.

posts.name: david wood
posts.cooked: believe me they cooked

posts.name: Zakk Jackson
posts.cooked: That trailer was better than any movie trailer I’ve seen in a while.
We really cooked.

posts.name: Saikiran Ramanan
posts.cooked: Instead of vague posting, why not actually post substantive content here if you truly believe this will help teams and change how folks do SW? I’m always interested in seeing what new resources are there and liked how accessible YAGSL was to some teams, but this all is pretty self-indulgent and is rubbing me the wrong way.

I don’t keep what we’ve made very secret. Anyone who looks closely can find it. Some already have. This is just to remind everyone that something is coming. I would appreciate no full links to repo’s until Oct 2nd bc the documentation is slightly more difficult (but certainly not impossible) to find.

Have you bothered to look close enough or just admonish what is effectively a marketing post bc our society needs constant reminders of new things coming up by relatively unknown authors?

posts.name: Saikiran Ramanan
posts.cooked:
nstrike:

Have you bothered to look close enough or just admonish what is effectively a marketing post bc our society needs constant reminders of new things coming up by relatively unknown authors?

I attempted to find information on this when you first announced it on Discord a few weeks ago and couldn’t find anything. I now see more information and pretty good documentation on the new Limelight accessors which is pretty neat, but not seeing anything on initial first glance relating to revolutionary simple sim.

Folks in the community do know of you and YAGSL , I wouldn’t sell yourself short. To me, it is frustrating to try to keep up with everything and not get anything substantive when reading a thread like this and needing to sign deeper to even find the premise.

Good luck with the release!

saikiranra:

new Limelight accessors

That isn’t even the half of it . Check out my CD post history for the rest of the story if you want to know ahead of time. I opened up the beta and have been admitting people in discord for a while now. All anyone had to do is ask!

posts.name: Chris
posts.cooked:
Screenshot 2025-09-23 064300 825×321 25.6 KB

Screenshot 2025-09-23 064300 825×321 25.6 KB

Screenshot 2025-09-23 064300 825×321 25.6 KB

I was blessed with the opportunity to help test and work on the mechanism library. The screenshot above shows the ENTIRE motor config with the new addition of the SmartMotorController. This one config is about 1/3 of the entire file as well which shows how little you need to program with this mechanism library. Seeing as this specifically is open beta still afaik, dropping a very small portion of the entire file seems like not too big of a deal.

posts.name: Dan Peled
posts.cooked: It’s been great helping this come to life! I’m sure this will have an impact on teams

4 more days!!!

Community dedicated to raising the floor for all FIRST Robotics Competition teams, and FIRST Tech Challenge teams through the advancement of common libraries and code generators. | 652 members

posts.name: Wilson
posts.cooked:
Excited to see it in action!! I’ve always found simulation especially a burden to configure in WPI lib with having to keep all the different vendor sim configurations in line. I had to add the image though as a developer joke download 299×169 8.57 KB

download 299×169 8.57 KB

download 299×169 8.57 KB
Its really cool bc it works with the vendordep sims to show relevant data in controlled (not followers) motor controllers from HALSim.
2 MORE DAYS!!!
